tn.text: Parallelism is common in Hebrew poetry. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_poetry]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
This is a song about God's faithfulness.
"This is for the director of music to use in worship"
"people should play a stringed instrument with this song"
Possible meanings are 1) David wrote the psalm or 2) the psalm is about David or 3) the psalm is in the style of David's psalms.

tn.ref: Hear my cry, God; attend to my prayer
tn.text: These clauses have a similar meaning. AT: "God, listen to me and answer my prayer" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: lead me to the rock that is higher than I
tn.text: Here the writer speaks of God as if he were a high rock that he could climb for protection. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: a strong tower from the enemy
tn.text: The implied words "that keeps me safe" can be added to the translation. AT: "you have been like a strong tower that keeps me safe from my enemy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
Here the writer speaks of God as if he were a "strong tower" that provides protection from his enemies. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: take refuge under the shelter of your wings
tn.text: Going to Yahweh for protection is spoken of as taking refuge in him. Here there is a second metaphor that speaks of Yahweh's protection as if he was a hen protecting her baby chicks under her wings. AT: "go to you for protection as a chick is safe under the wings of its mother" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: you have given me the inheritance
tn.text: The writer speaks of God's blessings as if they were an inheritance that he has received. AT: "you have given to me the blessings" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Here "your name" means God himself. AT: "who honor you" or "who have an awesome respect for you" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
These two clauses have similar meanings. The idea is repeated for emphasis. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: You will prolong the king's life
tn.text: "You will extend the king's life" or "You will cause the king's life to last a long time"

tn.ref: his years will be like many generations
tn.text: Here "years" refers to how long the king will live. AT: "he will live for many generations" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: He will remain before God forever
tn.text: Here "to remain before God" means to be in God's presence or to be with God. This can be stated clearly in the translation. AT: "God will be with him forever" or "God will be with the king forever" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: I will sing praise to your name forever
tn.text: Here "name" stands for God himself. AT: "I will always sing praise to you" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
These refer to the promise to offer sacrifices to God every day. (See UDB)
